results.title: Mufaro's beautiful daughters (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Paul R. Gagne and David R. Paight
results.brief_description: Everyone agrees that Mufaro’s two daughters are very beautiful - the kind Nyasha, and the selfish Manyara. When the king decides to take a wife, the girls are unknowingly tested to reveal which is worthy enough to be the queen. Based on the book by John Steptoe.

results.title: Muddy waters
results.brief_description: A story of land use and abuse in south-west USA. We see the area as it was before the advent of the colonists a few hundred years ago, and the same area as it is at the time of making this film (1937). Overgrazing and intensive farming has depleted soil binding vegetation, and the result is destruction of the soil by floods and erosion. Remedial measures are suggested, with emphasis on the urgent necessity for soil conservation practices.

results.title: Mud
results.brief_description: A study of urban erosion and sedimentation caused by the careless developer or roadbuilder. Explains how engineering skills and conservation practices often applied to rural areas can be used in cities to prevent flooding and other drainage difficulties.

results.title: Mud
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: An experimental film. Close shots of a bubbling pool of thermal mud in New Zealand are matched to primeval sounds evoking the creation of a world. The sounds are composed of plucked piano bass strings, especially recorded to capture reverberation, slowed-down cymbals, xylophone, wobble board and castanets.

results.title: Much ado about something
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Helpful Eye, Michael Rubbo and Penelope McDonald
results.brief_description: Written, directed, filmed and narrated by Michael Rubbo, “Much ado about something” presents a literary mystery into the authorship of the most famous playwright of all, William Shakespeare. There has been speculation surrounding his literary counterparts as possible sources for the text - Bacon, Freud, Twain - however Marlowe emerged as the main contender. Rubbo examines the Marlowe establishment - the appreciation society, critics, and most significantly, the actions of Calvin Hoffman, who, in 1984 exhumed a tomb in the belief that it contained a box of papers that would discredit Shakespeare. He also set a literary challenge for anyone to find proof of Marlowe as the true author with a monetary reward as incentive. The ancestry of Marlowe, his private life and questionable death are explored, as is evidence of Shakespeare’s education and family life.

results.title: Much ado about nut things: problem solving, estimation
results.brief_description: An animated film introducing the concept of estimation and suggests ways to use it in problem solving. Also illustrates the use of the calculator in estimating solutions to problems. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Much Ado about Nothing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
A comedy with two main plots. One concerns the love affair between Beatrice and Benedict, the other deals with the conspiracy against Claudio who is engaged to Beatrice’s gentle cousin, Hero. Don John, who hates Claudio stages a pretended assignation between Borachio, one of his followers, and Margaret, Hero’s maid, who is garbed as her mistress. Claudio, who witnesses the scene and suspects Hero’s virtue, rejects his bride at the altar, but the matter is finally cleared up, with the help of the good Friar Francis.

results.title: Much ado about nothing
results.creator_credit: Renaissance Films, Samuel Goldwyn, Kenneth Branagh, David Parfitt and Stephen Evans
results.brief_description: Once again Branagh has successfully brought Shakespeare to modern audiences in a way which will inspire and enthuse even those unfamiliar with the plays. “Much ado about nothing” is a romantic comedy which is full of energy, largely due to its inspired casting. The idyllic Italian countryside is the setting for the story of Hero and Claudio, a young couple whose impending marriage is thrown into jeopardy when Claudio is deceived by his brother Don John. Kenneth Branagh, Emma Thompson, Robert Sean Leonard, Denzel Washington, Keanu Reeves, Kate Beckinsale, Brian Blessed and Richard Briers star in this delightful adaptation while Michael Keaton and Ben Elton in cameos, steal the film with their brilliant comic caricatures.

results.title: MSX Sony ‘Hit Bit’ HB-75B game console and accessories
results.material_description: Video games console with game controllers. Does not include computer monitor. Comes in box with manuals and several magazine advertisements for the unit. Object display only and not functioning
results.brief_description: MSX Sony ‘Hit Bit’ HB-75B video games console. Black computer unit includes keyboard with overlay and adhesive label sheet. Also included are MSX-Basic Reference Chart, Operating Instructions, Programming Reference Manual, Introduction to MSX-Basic, ‘Match Maker’ advertising flyers, aerial/TV/Computer cable and original packaging box.
